title: Marketplace for Tuesday, February 19, 2013
byline: Jeff Tyler, Kai Ryssdal, Sam Beard, Nancy Marshall-Genzer, D Gorenstein and Scott Tong
teaser: The Chinese government is sponsoring cyber-espionage to attack top U.S. companies. The dreaded sequester is affecting all of Washington, D.C. Scott Tong takes a look at the Simpson-Bowles proposal to reduce the U.S. deficit. We explore how diamond thieves made away with millions in diamonds at the Brussels Airport. Dijon mustard brand Grey Poupon is trying to make a comeback. And Deferred Action, the immigration plan that allowed some immigrants brought to the U.S. as children to avoid deportation, celebrates its one-year anniversary.
